section_purpose: To evaluate the generalization ability of GNN models (MS-NSFG and MS-ESFG) on MaxSAT problems with distributions different from the training data, focusing on three aspects: clause-variable proportion, problem size/difficulty, and parameter k.
key_points: Focuses on three generalization types: different clause-variable proportions, larger/more difficult problems, and different parameter k (e.g., Max2SAT vs Max3SAT).
Models generalize well when clause-variable proportions are similar, maintaining high accuracy.
Models can handle larger problem sizes, indicating potential for solving difficult MaxSAT instances.
Generalization across different k is limited, with reduced accuracy and larger optimality gaps.
dependencies: GNN Models for MaxSAT section for details on MS-NSFG and MS-ESFG
Preliminaries or SAT and MaxSAT sections for background on MaxSAT
reproducibility_notes: Specific training and testing datasets used
Metrics: gap to optimal objective and approximation ratio
